com.microsoft.azure.iothub

Class DeviceClientConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.iothub.DeviceClientConfig

  • public final class DeviceClientConfig
extends Object
    Configuration settings for an IoT Hub client. Validates all user-defined settings.

    • Field Detail

      • TOKEN_VALID_SECS

        public static final long TOKEN_VALID_SECS
        The number of seconds after which the generated SAS token for a message will become invalid. We also use the expiry time, which is computed as currentTime() + DEVICE_KEY_VALID_LENGTH, as a salt when generating our SAS token. Use getTokenValidSecs() instead in case the field becomes configurable later on.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_READ_TIMEOUT_MILLIS

        public static final int DEFAULT_READ_TIMEOUT_MILLIS
        The default value for readTimeoutMillis.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MESSAGE_LOCK_TIMEOUT_SECS

        public static final int DEFAULT_MESSAGE_LOCK_TIMEOUT_SECS
        The default value for messageLockTimeoutSecs.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeviceClientConfig

        public DeviceClientConfig(String iotHubHostname,
                          String deviceId,
                          String deviceKey)
                   throws URISyntaxException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        iotHubHostname - the IoT Hub hostname.
        deviceId - the device ID.
        deviceKey - the device key.
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException - if the IoT Hub hostname does not conform to RFC 3986.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the IoT Hub hostname does not contain a valid IoT Hub name as its prefix.

      • getTokenValidSecs

        public long getTokenValidSecs()
        Getter for the number of seconds a SAS token should be valid for. A message that arrives at an IoT Hub in time of length greater than this value will be rejected by the IoT Hub.
        Returns:
        the number of seconds a message in transit to an IoT Hub is valid for.

      • getReadTimeoutMillis

        public int getReadTimeoutMillis()
